thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: WeWork’s Debt Receives Junk Rating

author: Esther Fung
title: WeWork’s Debt Receives Junk Rating
text:
Shared-workspace firm WeWork Cos. Inc. is planning to tap the bond market, according to reports by ratings companies, which have offered a glimpse into the New York-based startup’s financial health.
On Tuesday, S&P Global Ratings assigned a corporate credit rating of B to WeWork, while Fitch Ratings gave the eight-year-old company a long-term issuer default rating of BB-. For both firms, the ratings are below BBB- and so are considered non-investment-grade, or junk. Both firms issued a stable outlook.
